{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Linksys |model=RE9000 |revision=v1 |series=AC3000 |upc=745883742837 |asin=B076ZHXK6J |newegg=9SIA25V6UV1821 |price=170 |manuf_country=Taiwan |is_manuf=No |manuf=U-MEDIA |availability=now |est_release_date=11/14/2017 |fcc_date=10/26/2017 |fcc_id=Q87-RE9000 |ic_id=3839A-RE9000 |pcb_id=0500-2540910300 |type=range extender |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_outer=5.5 |pwr_barrel_inner=2.1 |cpu1_brand=MediaTek |cpu1_model=MT7621AT;MEDIATEK, MT7621AT, 1715-AMTH, CTPCVN32, DTPCTV60; |cpu1_cspeed=880 |cpu1_cores=2 |fla1=16 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX25L12835FM2I-10G |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=Nanya |ram1_model=NT5CC64M16GP-DI |serial=yes,, 3.3V TTL,, 4-pin header,, unpopulated,, J1 |wi1_chip1_brand=MediaTek |wi1_chip1_model=MT7615DN;MEDIATEK, ARM, MT7615DN, 1724-BFSL, ACMS2T53; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand=MediaTek |wi2_chip1_model=MT7615N;MEDIATEK, ARM, MT7615N, 1717-BFAL, ACMSMG34; |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=4 |wi2_rxchains=4 |wi2_sstreams=4 |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |lan_speed=1GbE |lan_ports=4 |addl_chips=5GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SKY85728-11;SKY85728-11, 645LE, 1645, MY;6;,,, 800ma Low Dropout Linear Regulator;National Semiconductor;LM1117;;1; |flags=MU-MIMO, 256QAM |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_ssid=Linksys Extender Setup |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui=24:F5:A2, 30:23:03 |oui_eth=24:F5:A2, 30:23:03 }}
:• '''1733''' Mbps - 4SS 5GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ac#Data_rates_and_speed 802.11ac] (80MHz chan.) backhaul :• '''867''' Mbps - 2SS 5GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ac#Data_rates_and_speed 802.11ac] (80MHz chan.) :• '''400''' Mbps - 2SS 2.4GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11n-2009#Data_rates 802.11n] (40MHz chan., 256QAM) = '''''AC3000'' class'''
{{TagLine|Max-Stream Tri-Band AC3000 Wi-Fi Range Extender}} :{{ProductPage|https://www.linksys.com/us/p/P-RE9000/}} {{SupportPage|vendor=Linksys|model=RE9000|pid=01t34000004NVaDAAW}} *[https://www.linksys.com/us/pressreleases/linksys-announces-powerful-new-max-stream-tri-band-range-extender%20/ ''Press releases'' on '''Linksys'''] (Nov 14, 2017) :Web GUI: http://extender.linksys.com "0500-2540910300" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. {{See also|Linksys RE7000|Linksys|Belkin|U-MEDIA}} ===FCC info=== FCC documents suggest that this device is 4T4R (UNII-1) and 2T2R (UNII-3) for 5GHz and :2T2R for 2.4GHz. It's not immediately obvious which radio implements which band(s). Two 5GHz FEMs (SKY85728-11) are connected to the MT7615DN and four FEMs are :connected to the MT7615N but only two are visible and both are also SKY85728-11. The two FEMs not shown are probably also [[Skyworks]] SKY85728-11. :The MT7615N is supposedly capable of 4T4R or 2x 2T2R. Looking at the [[Linksys EA7500 v2]], another Linksys device with MT7615N chips, :the 2.4GHz radio does not have any typical FEMs. I'm guessing that the MT7615N provides the four-stream backhaul link and :the MT7615DN provides two-stream 5GHz (an+ac) / 2.4GHz (bgn). ===Reviews=== *[https://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/33168-linksys-re9000-mu-mimo-range-extender-reviewed ''Linksys RE9000 MU-MIMO Range Extender'' on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] ===See also=== :;[[List of Linksys Wireless Devices#Repeaters/Range Extenders|Repeaters/Range Extenders]] • [https://www.linksys.com/us/range-extenders/c/wireless-wi-fi-range-extenders/ Wireless Range Extenders] *[[Linksys RE6250]] • AC750 Dual-Band WiFi Range Extender *[[Linksys RE6300]] • AC750 BOOST Wi-Fi Range Extender :• FCC ID: Q87-RE6300 (2015-09-17) • [http://www.linksys.com/us/p/P-RE6300/ PPage] *[[Linksys RE6350]] • AC1200 Dual-Band WiFi Range Extender *[[Linksys RE6400]] • AC1200 BOOST EX [http://www.linksys.com/us/p/P-RE6500HG/ PPage] *[[Linksys RE6700]] • AC1200 AMPLIFY Dual-Band Wi-Fi Range Extender :• FCC ID: Q87-RE6700 (2015-04-17) Wireless Extender *[[Linksys RE6800]] • AC1900
